Ad Text:
About Us

AUTONOMA specialises in process automation across physical and digital environments, using advanced AI and industrial automation technologies to solve the dull, dirty, dangerous, and difficult tasks in industry.

We design and deliver reliable, industrial‑grade automation solutions for challenging environments. Our work spans robotics, control systems, software automation, and bespoke engineering solutions for clients across Australia.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Graduate Automation Engineer who is excited to build a career in industrial automation and develop deep expertise in Industrial Automation and Robotics.

This role is ideal for someone who is hands‑on, curious, and keen to learn how real‑world control systems are designed, built, programmed, and commissioned. You’ll be supported by senior engineers while contributing to live client projects.

What You Will Do

You’ll work alongside experienced engineers to:

Assist with designing and programming Siemens PLC and HMI systems

Support development and testing using TIA Portal and WinCC

Learn, program and commission Industrial Robotic Systems

Participate in on-site commissioning and system upgrades

Help troubleshoot control system and electrical faults

Collaborate with clients, electricians, and project teams

Contribute to technical documentation and system deliverables

About You

You are a recent graduate who wants genuine hands-on experience with industrial control systems.

Required:

Degree in Electrical, Mechatronics, Automation, or similar

Understanding of PLC programming concepts (Siemens preferred)

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Willingness to work on-site around industrial equipment

Good communication and teamwork skills

Australian work rights and valid driver’s licence

Nice to Have (but not required):

Exposure to Siemens TIA Portal, WinCC, or PLC hardware

Understanding of Profinet/Profibus

Internship or project experience in control systems or automation

Interest in robotics, SCADA, lab automation, or functional safety

Travel Requirements

Occasional travel to client sites (metro and regional)

Some short‑notice travel depending on project needs

All required training and supervision provided

What We Offer

Competitive graduate salary

Real hands-on experience with industrial automation projects

Mentoring from senior automation engineers

A collaborative and technically focused team environment

How to Apply

If you’re passionate about automation and want to begin your engineering career working on real industrial systems, we’d love to hear from you.
